intro: Valeriana acutiloba var. acutiloba, commonly known as narrow-leaved valerian, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to regions of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pale pink to white flowers arranged in dense, spike-like inflorescences. Its roots are often harvested for their aromatic compounds, which have been used in traditional medicine. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
